meanings.definition: Having more blobs or a larger blob-like shape.
meanings.sent1: The blobbier cloud looked like a fluffy pillow in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The cake became blobbier as more frosting was added.
meanings.sent3: The blobbier balloon slowly floated away, carrying a tiny mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts felt blobbier than usual, swirling around in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The blobbier paint splatter resembled a colorful explosion on the canvas.

meanings.sent1: The blobbier mass of clay refused to take any specific shape.
meanings.sent2: The shadow grew blobbier as the light dimmed in the room.
meanings.sent3: The blobbier jelly jiggled on the plate, much to the amusement of the children.
meanings.sent4: His excuses became blobbier with each attempt to explain his actions.
meanings.sent5: The blobbier fog enveloped the town, making it hard to see beyond a few feet.
